description: Quality tier definitions for commodities. Quality affects fulfillment multipliers and class acceptance.

tiers.name: Poor
tiers.description: Low quality goods, often damaged or spoiled. Only accepted by lower classes.

tiers.name: Basic
tiers.description: Standard quality goods. Accepted by most classes.

tiers.name: Good
tiers.description: Above average quality goods. Preferred by middle and upper classes.

tiers.name: Luxury
tiers.description: High quality goods. Preferred by elite and upper classes.

tiers.name: Masterwork
tiers.description: Exceptional quality goods. Only the elite can appreciate these.

productionRules.description: How quality is determined during production

workerSkill.description: Higher skill workers produce higher quality

buildingLevel.description: Higher level buildings enable higher quality

inputQuality.description: Quality of inputs affects output quality

upgradeChance.description: Chance to produce one tier higher than expected

degradeChance.description: Chance to produce one tier lower than expected

classAcceptance.description: Which classes accept which quality tiers (reference only - actual data in character_classes.json)
